question.name: mm_to_hs_transform
question.description: Retrieve human (Hs) gene orthologs for the genes this search result. After this transformation, the strategy can be extended further to compare against human proteomics datasets. Ortholog data (MGI -> HGNC mappings) are taken from the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committe (HGNC) approved human gene annotation.
question.summary: Retrieve human gene orthologs for the genes this search result.

question.name: hs_upload
question.description:
Provide a list of genes/proteins of interest by entering a new line or comma separated list of genes below.

Alternatively upload a text file containing a new line separated list of genes.

Genes/proteins can be specified using Ensembl, Entrez, MGI, Uniprot, or Official Gene Symbol. Symbols will map thru synonyms only if the Include Synonyms? option is set to Yes.

sqlQuery.name: from_mm
sqlQuery.sql:
WITH result AS ($$mgene_answer$$)
SELECT DISTINCT first_value(human.source_id) OVER wnd AS source_id, 'ErythronDB'::text AS project_id, 1 AS wdk_weight FROM CBIL.GeneAttributes human, CBIL.GeneAttributes mouse, result WHERE mouse.annotation->>'mgi_id' = human.annotation->>'mgd_id' AND mouse.source_id = result.source_id
WINDOW wnd AS ( -- transform only allows for 1 to 1 mappings PARTITION BY result.source_id ORDER BY (lower(mouse.gene_symbol) = lower(human.gene_symbol)) DESC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND UNBOUNDED FOLLOWING )

sqlQuery.name: upload
sqlQuery.sql: WITH ds AS ($$ds_gene_identifiers$$) SELECT ga.source_id, '@PROJECT_ID@'::text AS project_id /* , ds.identifier AS search_term */ FROM CBIL.GeneIdentifiers gi, ds, CBIL.GeneAttributes ga WHERE ds.source_id ILIKE gi.external_id AND ga.gene_id = gi.gene_id AND (CASE WHEN $$incl_synonyms$$ = 'yes' THEN TRUE ELSE gi.dbref_id NOT IN ('alias_symbol', 'prev_symbol') END) AND ga.organism = $$taxon$$

sqlQuery.name: gene_list
sqlQuery.sql: SELECT unnest(string_to_array($$gene_list$$::text, ',')) AS source_id, '@PROJECT_ID@'::text AS project_id, $$annotation$$::text AS annotation
